name: Doubletree by Hilton Hotel Leeds City Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night and had a really comfortable stay. The room was compact but perfectly formed! Everything is very modern, clean and sparce. I liked the applemac replacement for a TV and we made use of the DVD library at reception - this is free to guests and they had quite a good selection.
reviews.title: Modern clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a cocktail in the Skybar, although it was very windy and wet outside, so we didn't get to go outside.
reviews.title: Great hotel - Great service
Recommended.....but!
reviews.text: Breakfast was included and was very tasty. Made to order rather than a buffet which I prefer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would stay here again, but I usually like to try different hotels each time.
reviews.title: Very impressed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at City Inn Leeds on Saturday night. The check in staff were extremely friendly and we were upgraded to a Junior Suite. Room was lovely, very modern and large and particularly loved the floor to ceiling windows that made up much of the wall space.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service

reviews.text: I'm a frequent visitor to the City Inn and have become absolutely fed up with the poor service at breakfast, which is served undercooked (raw eggs) and cold and usually when colleagues have finished theirs! Many times items have been forgotten and they struggle to do the simplest things - e.g. bring eggs and toast over together (the toast came 30 mins after eggs, even after chasing twice!!) The concierge pays no attention to the customers, but rushes about ineffectively.
reviews.title: Please sort out the breakfast!

reviews.text: The rooms are great, nice and clean, please City Inn sort out your breakfasts!!
reviews.title: A great hotel, with good location

reviews.text: Have stayed in the hotel twice now, excellent service with spacious and modern rooms. Like the Apple Macs in the rooms and the wireless internet. Great location near to the station and within minutes of the shops. Only complaints are that the air-conditioning is extremely noisy and largely ineffective and the parking is £12 a night and in limited supply, however the parking staff are very helpful and attentive.
reviews.title: Great location and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying at the City Inn at Westminster last year we decided to try the Leeds version when we visited last weekend. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Excellent stay and great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think what makes the City Inn brand better than most other hotels is the friendly and helpful nature of all of the staff. The rooms are good and the location is excellent.
reviews.title: Lush!

reviews.text: Room - very comfortable, has Apple desktop with internet access AND wireless, great bed and shower, big fluffy towels etc, good workspace;
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel - really nice design;
reviews.title: Great Horel - Great Location!
Great staff,great location and great city.
reviews.text: Service - with a smile;

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant - fantastic breakfast with loads of choice and hot food served at table. Evening snack very nice;
reviews.title: Fantastic staff

reviews.text: Location - very central but in a newly developed canal area so perfect.
reviews.title: brilliant for the price and location

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel after a night out in Leeds with friends. A small problem finding the car park for the hotel but when we phoned lost in Leeds City centre the hotel sent a member of staff out into the city to find us and guide me to the car park. The room was very modern and impressive and small touches like a bowl of fresh fruit in the room was appreciated and a treat. the bar on the roof top was also a fantastic feature and they stayed open longer just for us. Breakfast in the morning was top class and the staff were very helpful throughout. Would definitely recommend and as a travel agent will be sending many more customers to this hotel.
reviews.title: Super Modern Hotel With 5 Star Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the City Inn for 3 nights over the Easter Weekend and I am totally impressed with this great all round hotel.
reviews.title: Not hard to see why it's number 1 hotel in Leeds!

reviews.text: The price is amazing for such a great hotel, representing great value for money. I was slightly concerned about the car parking, but we parked in the NCP car park on Boar Lane, which is about a 5 min walk from the hotel. The reception staff can give you a special pass that reduces the 24 hour stay in this car park from £13 to £5. The hotel is located in an area that's clearly undergone a lot of regeneration lately. On the approaching drive you go through a pretty run down industrial area, but the canalside area is lovely. It's about a ten minute walk to shops and bars, which was ideal.
reviews.title: Absolutely outstanding hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were very helpful when we checked in after a long drive from Edinburgh, and gave us a thorough run through of the hotel and facilities and took care of our bags for the rest of the day until we got back mid-afternoon. There was an interesting art exhibition in the foyer, which was an unusual touch, and there were a lot of press cuttings on the wall by the lifts giving rave reviews of the hotel, bars and restaurant.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, great Skylounge, central location, great value and service

reviews.text: The room was on the 9th floor and had beautiful views over the canal and Leeds. When we arrived the room was very clean, fresh and modern. The pics I had seen on the internet made it look a bit like a student hall of residence, but it wasn't like that at all. The bathroom was beautiful with a large high pressure shower and trendy style sink. The white company toiletries were a nice touch, but its a shame they top up the fixed handwash and shower gel with water to make the bottles look full all the time.
reviews.title: sunday lunch here is the best ever

description: Our new Leeds hotel is part of the revitalised Granary Wharf area, next to Leeds station and the canal. All 333 of our bedrooms are styled with absolute consideration for your comfort and feature our award winning multimedia iMac computer, complimentary wi-fi and Sky in every room. Dine in the sophisticated surroundings of City Café restaurant or dine alfresco on our south facing, canalside terrace. 13th Floor Skylounge where you will find a breath taking view of the city.
